title: James Maddison withdraws from England squad due to illness
text:
James Maddison will have to wait a little longer to make his senior England debut after withdrawing from the current squad due to illness.

The Leicester midfielder was hopeful of being involved in the Euro 2020 qualifiers against the Czech Republic and Bulgaria, but has now had to pull out. No replacement will be called up.

Maddison, 22, has been one of the most impressive midfielders in the Premier League this season and would have hoped to play a part in the qualifiers.

Illness has forced James Maddison to withdraw from Gareth Southgate's latest England squad

Maddison (right) pictured in the gym at St George's Park this week alongside Declan Rice

He will now recover at his club and will hope to return to action in their next Premier League game, against Burnley at the King Power Stadium on October 19.

Maddison has two goals and two assists in the league this season, scoring the winner against Tottenham last month and the equaliser in Leicester’s 2-1 defeat at Liverpool last Saturday.

He returned from an ankle injury to play at Anfield, which had kept him out of the 5-0 win over Newcastle on September 29.
description: The Leicester midfielder was hopeful of being involved in the Euro 2020 qualifiers against the Czech Republic and Bulgaria, but has now had to pull out. No replacement will be called up.
